context.p: You can open a document in Serna several ways:

p.xref: Opening a document in WYSIWYG mode

li.p: By default, documents are opened in WYSIWYG mode.
Serna automatically applies a document template on opening a document, but you can also open a document with manually specified parameters.
Serna allows you to work with very large documents by collapsing portions of them.

p.xref: Opening a document in Text mode

li.p: You can open a document straight away in Text mode.

p.xref: Opening a document from the Recent Files list

li.p: The last several documents opened in Serna can be opened from the list of recent files. In this case, some meta information is applied exactly as it was the previous time.

li.xref: Opening a document from the command line
li.p: You can open a document in Serna by executing a command from the command line.
